DataElement.preferredName: Adequate Specimen Submitted Procedure Timepoint Or Patient Biopsy Immunohistochemical Genetic Testing Agreement Consent Trial Eligibility Criteria Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator to determine clinical trial participation for questions that address the submission of adequate specimens, procedure timepoints, or the patientÂ’s consent to the removal of tissue samples for immunohistochemical assessment and genetic testing.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Sufficient Biospecimen Submission Intervention or Procedure Timepoint Or Patient Biopsy Immunohistochemical Test Genetic Testing Agreement Consent Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions._The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something._An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis._A diagnostic test in which an antibody is used to link a cellular antigen specifically to a stain that can be seen with a microscope._Analyzing DNA to look for a genetic alteration that may indicate an increased risk for developing a specific disease or disorder._The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion._Permission to do something._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement; enough to meet the needs of a situation.:Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement; enough to meet the needs of a situation.

Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredName: Submission Intervention or Procedure Timepoint Or Patient Biopsy Immunohistochemical Test Genetic Testing Agreement Consent Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.:A diagnostic test in which an antibody is used to link a cellular antigen specifically to a stain that can be seen with a microscope.:Analyzing DNA to look for a genetic alteration that may indicate an increased risk for developing a specific disease or disorder.:The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion.:Permission to do something.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.
A diagnostic test in which an antibody is used to link a cellular antigen specifically to a stain that can be seen with a microscope.
The process of isolating and testing the DNA of an embryo or a person to detect the presence of genetic alterations or defects that may predispose to the future development of a disease or disorder.
The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion.
Permission to do something.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has adequate archival tissue
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has adequate archival tissue specimen from a biopsy performed after progression of disease on most recent therapy been submitted OR patient is willing to undergo a new core or excisional biopsy to obtain evaluable tumor tissue sample for immunohistochemical assessment and sequencing for B2M loss?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has adequate archival tissue specimen (25+ unstained slides or 2 tissue blocks) from a biopsy performed after progression of disease on most recent therapy been submitted OR patient is willing to undergo a new core or excisional biopsy to obtain evaluable tumor tissue sample for immunohistochemical assessment and sequencing for B2M loss?
